Communication is an essential part of building a connection with the people around us. In this blog, you'll begin the journey of learning how to foster robust communication with your child.

![](../figures/comm_aac.png)

>
“To effectively communicate, we must realize that we are all different in the way we perceive the world and use this understanding as a guide to our communication with others.” 
— Tony Robbins
>

This blog series on “Communication and AAC”, is a written summary of a lesson by Caitlin Burke, Speech-Language Pathologist and founder of The Little Speech Tree. 

Here, the series is broken into 3 parts:

1.	[What is AAC?](../aac_1/index.qmd)
2.	Shifting our Mindset
    - [Advocating for Multimodal Communication](../aac_2/advocacy_why.qmd)
    - [How to Advocate for Multimodal Communication](../aac_2/advocacy_how.qmd)
    - [Why is there reluctance to Use AAC?](../aac_2/reluctance.qmd)
    - [Power Imbalances: Speaking vs AAC use](../aac_2/pwr_imbalance.qmd)
3.	[Our Role in Supporting AAC Users](../aac_3/supporting_aac_users.qmd)
